result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas S Tourtillott was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS A RESULT OF PROBATION HEARING HELD ON 7/25/2017, WHEREIN THE DEFENDANT DID NOT APPEAR.  PROBATION IS ORDERED EXTENDED UNTIL THE DEFENDANT CAN BE LOCATED AND A HEARING CAN BE HELD WITH THE DEFENDANT PRESENT IN COURT.  THE COURT WILL THEN DETERMINE THE LENGTH OF THE EXTENSION.

AS A RESULT OF A PROBATION REVIEW HEARING HELD ON 1/18/18.   Probation is ordered extended up to one year from today's date.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments toward his court ordered financial obligations, continue AODA and recommended treatment, and seek and maintain employment.  May apply for early discharge if he pays the court ordered financial obligations in full.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CT29.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling/treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  Must enroll in any other random testing program deemed appropriate by your probation agent.

timeConds.notes:
To be served at the direction of the treatment court team.  Must be equipped with a SCRAM unit or SOBERLINK upon release.  AMENDED 4-2-15:  The SCRAM or SOBERLINK requirement is removed.  All remaining jail time is stayed pending the successful completion of probation.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CT29.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

Find time served.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CT29.
A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.addlTxt: Paper file destroyed

District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections noted.  State recommended:  9 months jail in 14CT29.  12 months jail in 14CF120. Concurrent.  Defense recommends: 9 months jail in 14CT29. 12 months jail in 14CF120.  Concurrent.  Credit for 331 days.   Defendant exercised his right to allocution.

Court ordered: 9 months jail in 14CT20. 12 months jail in 14CF120.  Concurrent.  Find time served.  Credit for 331 days.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
sent ROAW to Judge this date.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 25, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

Revocation Summary
from DOC
Judgment vacated this 18th day of January, 2018 at 1:44 pm.  Probation has been extended and the fine and costs are again collected through probation.  Jan Moennig, Clerk of Court

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  No counsel present.  No victims in this case.  Defendant called SPD.  They said they couldn't represent him.  He wishes to proceed without counsel.  Court questioned the defendant regarding self representation.  He understood.  Court found the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to an attorney.  Court attempted to contact his probation agent.  No answer.  Tried twice.  State recommended:  probation extended 1 or more years.  Defendant understood.  Defendant said he can pay $200.00 per month towards the court costs and fees.  Court ordered:  Continue AODA, seek and maintain employment, make monthly payments.  Extend probation for up to 1 year.  May apply for early discharge if he pays the obligations in full.  Report to his agent within 24 hours of release.  Bond vacated.
Probation review hearing on January 18, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail without counsel present.  Special Prosecutor Taavi McMahan appeared by phone.

Hearing is recorded:

14CF120 & 14CT29:  Defendant appears by video from JASO without counsel present.  Special Prosecutor Taavi McMahan appears for the State.  He failed to appear at the probation review hearing on 11-13-17 and that's why warrants were issued.  Per DA he has absconded from probation and requests a cash bond on these cases.  

14CF120 requests a $1000 cash bond with condiditon:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

14CT29:  State requests a $500 cash bond with same conditions as 14CF120.

Court orders bonds in both cases as requested.  J.A. will reschedule the probation review hearings in these cases.  Defendant is notified to contact SPDO and given other attorney options.

to signature bond

Covers 14CF120 and 14CT29.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Contact his probation agent.

Judge granted the Motion and added these conditions:   Defendant must execute all releases of information for assessments, counseling, treatment, to allow probation agent to verify compliance.  Must enroll in any other random testing program deemed appropriate by your probation agent.

This bond coveres cases 14CM106 and 14ct29:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. May not be released until equipped with a SCRAM unit .

Pre-trial conference on May 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
DESTROYED

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  If bond is posted defendant must be equipped with a SCRAM unit.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
